name: Coq au Vin
description: Embrace the rustic charm of French dining right from your own kitchen! Coq au Vin is a classic French stew braised in red wine. Effortlessly prep this one-pot, gourmet classic on a dime for any occasion—from Christmas to “Friendsgiving!” It’s the ultimate main course that says, “I’ve got this,” even when time is of the essence.
preparation: Heat butter or oil in Sauté Pan. Slice chicken thighs in half, add to pan, and brown.
Add carrot and mushrooms to pan. Stir-fry 3 min, or until mushrooms start to soften.
Stir in seasoning and wine; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 10 min. Uncover and simmer for 3–5 min, or until sauce thickens.
tips: Swap low-sodium chicken broth for dry red wine or use a combination.
For a deeper flavour, marinate chicken in red wine and seasoning overnight. Reserve the marinade and use in pan to cook chicken.
